items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what was wanted with fit
items.body: Bought this for my daughter and it fits BEAUTIFULLY on her. She in a teen and it's appropriate with still being very cute! XS fits true. Read more

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute comfortable and affordable!
items.body: This dress is amazing!!!! I bought for a wedding and was a little worried that it would be to causal or low quality. But it was perfect and comfortable while still looking adorable! Read more
items.author: Lisa Moorman

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly as described
items.body: Bought this dress for my daughter and it fit her perfectly. Only thing is once you get it, it's git to be hung and steamed to get the wrinkles out from shipping. Read more
items.author: Kelly Vann

items.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good!
items.body: I (5'4" & 245lbs) bought the 2XL in Royal Blue. The dress looks nice overall with a few minor issues. It fits well with plenty of stretch. I didn't even need to use the zipper to get it on or off. The seams line up a little oddly against my body's natural proportions. (Perhaps I could have gone down a size to a 1X?) The sleeves fit well, not too snug but secure. The front hem came down juuust below my knees and the back hem just below my calves. The fabric itself felt soft and smooth. It also had a 'quality weight' feeling to it and was not 'thin looking' when held up against the light. (The deeper color may have helped with this.) There were a few loose threads that didn't simply 'pull away' and will need trimmed or affixed. The royal blue color was a little darker than I expected - less 'Bright Blue' as shown and a little more 'Bright Navy'. Read more
items.author: Kira R.

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Classy, well made dress.
items.body: Needed a dress for a formal event and Amazon rarely disappoints. This dress was very classy, simple, and well made. I love the high-low hem which allowed for good air-flow on a warm evening, but also gave a nice shape. The fabric is on the thicker side. I thought with the A-line waist I could get away with a bikini undie, but because of the heavy drape, I didn't do that. The off the shoulder style is really pretty and flattering; however, if you raise your arms up too high (like fiddling with your hair, or giving hugs) you will have to readjust the hem line throughout the night. I also liked that I don't have to worry about deodorant stains with the way the sleeves are--such an odd bonus to highlight, but a bonus nonetheless! Read more
items.author: Amanda

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great dress
items.body: It did everything it was supposed to do! I wanted something simple since we were having a backyard wedding. It was sooo cute and cost friendly! Itâ€™s stretchy, comfy, and sexy! Read more
items.author: Tye S

items.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Casual dress is okay and thin
items.body: More of a casual dress, does not look as formal as the picture, but okay. Read more
items.author: Philter

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nicely made and I understand the mixed size reviews.
items.body: I ordered this dress at the last minute, a little nervously since lots of reviews were mixed on sizing up or down. I decided to size down to a medium. Given my 5' 2" 160lbs. pear shape (36-32-43), I felt like a large might be on the long side and I usually don't like the high/low hem style to begin with. It wasn't my first choice because of reviews and the hem style, but needed a dressy option that would arrive on time and could pass as a prom outfit for my wedding anniversary/prom night at WDW-Epcot (checking off "drinking around the world" and redoing "prom night" from our bucket list). What I wanted was ease of movement, comfort and a dressy but understated style. Also, since Central Florida in November is still warm but can get cool by night fall, the material had to be able to meet the weather conditions without me having to drag a jacket around the park. When I received the dress, I immediately noticed the color was a bit off to me. I wanted the navy blue and when I checked my order, I realized that I had ordered the purplish-blue instead. Despite my disappointment, the color was still very nice, so I decided to try it on and it was so close to navy blue that I didn't mind it at all. All this to say that it's more blue than purple if that's important to you. I initially tried it on with a bra and it was a cute fit, cinched my waist and the sleeve didn't feel tight or constricting. It has a nice medium weight to it so material wise it didn't feel heavy or itchy. It has a little give in the arms, but it was just a bit snug in the middle (around the ribs and tummy), however that worked in my favor because I was going to use a shaper and realized I didn't have to (my upper mommy tummy was being held in by the dress)! The high end of the hem hit just at the knee (on the model it hits her mid/upper thigh), so I was hoping for just above the knee, but I've accepted my shortness, so I half expected this. Other observations: it's zippered in the back and helps shape the upper part of the dress. The top of the dress and skirted part are sewn together, so on me the banded seam sits just below the belly button. I would also consider the band is about 1 1/2 inches wide (where the zipper stops and flares out into the skirt part). I'm mentioning this because in bright light I noticed my whole tummy wasn't completely held in, but it wasn't that noticeable to affect my review and the flare is forgiving in that area. The day of, I slipped it on and zipped it up without my bra and found that the girls were secure (I'm a B cup and still perky in the chesticles post 3 babies) so I decided to go braless after asking my hubby if he could tell whether or not I was wearing one. I wore a heeled sneaker with it and managed to pull off a classy look and still be comfy! I think it would be super cute belted, but all the belts I looked at wouldn't have arrived on time and definitely will do that the next time I wear it. Overall I checked off most of my "wants" and I may order a different color in large. Although it was a great fit, the snug waist means there's no room for the days when my body holds a bit of extra water weight, which is at least true for me. My suggestion is to order your true size AND a size down then decide for yourself the best fit. It is a 50/50 shot, but I was pleasantly surprised and understand the reviews a bit better now that I tried it! We received many compliments that day and I felt great in it! Read more
items.author: Koibito

short_description:
Womens Dress Short Sleeve Cocktail is made for a polished look that still feels comfortable to wear. It is designed to sit cleanly on the body with a flattering shape that works for day plans and dressier moments without feeling overdone.

The fit focuses on balance rather than extremes, so you can move naturally while still getting a defined silhouette. Choose your usual size for a closer look, or size up if you prefer a little more ease through the waist and hips.

Styling is simple: keep accessories minimal for a clean finish, or add a jacket and statement shoes when you want a sharper outfit. This piece photographs well thanks to smooth lines and a structured feel that stays put once you have it adjusted.

With the right fit and simple styling, this item becomes an easy go-to when you want something that looks intentional without requiring extra effort.

For the best look, smooth the fabric, check the neckline placement, and pair it with shoes that match the occasion and the hem length.

To keep it looking sharp, follow the care label first and avoid high heat when drying or steaming if the material is sensitive.

long_description:
Womens Dress Short Sleeve Cocktail is a versatile piece you can reach for when you want a put-together look that still feels comfortable. The goal is simple: a silhouette that reads polished, photographs well, and stays wearable for a full day or a long night.

Fit and sizing Fit is where most outfits win or lose. This design aims for a balanced shape with a defined line through the torso, a clean waist, and a smooth finish through the hips and legs. If you prefer a more relaxed feel, size up; if you like a closer fit, stay true to size. Sizes may include: 5, 5.5, 6, 6.5, 7, 7.5, 8, 8.5, 9, 9.5, 10, 11.

Fabric and comfort Comfort is not just about softness. It is also about movement and how the fabric behaves as you walk, sit, and stand. A fabric blend with a bit of give helps it keep its shape while still feeling wearable.

Highlights A clean neckline and a refined silhouette for an elevated look. Designed to layer easily with jackets, wraps, or sweaters. Works well with both minimal accessories and statement pieces.

How to style Styling ideas: keep it minimal with neutral shoes and one standout accessory. For a relaxed daytime look, add a denim jacket or cardigan. For events, switch to a bolder shoe and a small clutch for a sharper finish.

Color notes Available colors may include: Red, Lightpink, White, Blue, Purple, Yellow, Darkblue, Burgundy, Royalblue, Black, Purplishblue, Rosered. If a shade is sold out, check back as availability can change.

Care Care guidance matters if you want it to keep its shape and finish. Follow the label first.
